question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate can be executed and displayed. Please help me implement the following requirement using code: create a black and white photo of an infinity symbol using SVG code.

checklist.title: Is the SVG infinity symbol correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code accurately creates an infinity symbol (âˆž) using SVG path elements. The path should have a mathematically correct shape with proper curvature and symmetry. Score 0 if no infinity shape is visible, 5 if the shape is approximate but has flaws in symmetry, and 10 if the infinity symbol is perfectly formed with smooth curves and perfect symmetry.

checklist.title: Is the black and white photo effect properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG includes proper filters or styling to create a black and white photo effect. This should include appropriate grayscale effects, contrast adjustments, or filter combinations that mimic a photographic feel. Deduct 5 points if only basic black/white colors are used without any photographic effects, and 3 points if the effect lacks depth or realism. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the SVG responsive and properly viewable?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG has proper viewport settings, preserveAspectRatio attributes, and responsive design techniques to ensure it displays correctly on different screen sizes. Verify that the viewBox is correctly set and all content is visible without cropping. Deduct 5 points if the symbol doesn't scale properly, and 3 points if parts of the graphic are cut off in some viewports. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are advanced SVG features utilized appropriately?
checklist.description: Assess the use of advanced SVG features like gradients, filters, masks, or texture effects to enhance the photo-realistic quality. Check for proper use of lighting effects, shadow, or texture overlays to create depth and dimension. Deduct 3 points for each missed opportunity to use appropriate advanced features, with a maximum deduction of 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle different browser environments and whether it includes fallbacks or polyfills for cross-browser compatibility. Code with strong robustness should work reliably across modern browsers and degrade gracefully in older ones, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if compatibility issues are likely, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Subtle animation that simulates film grain 2. Interactive elements that respond to user input 3. Creative texture or lighting effects beyond simple black and white). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements or paths that accomplish the same visual effect 2. Excessive use of filters that don't contribute to the photo effect 3. Unnecessary complexity that impacts render performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core visual is made unclear by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review code organization (such as proper commenting, meaningful element IDs), optimization techniques (path simplification, appropriate precision), and adherence to SVG best practices. Deduct 5 points if element IDs are missing or non-descriptive; deduct 5 points if the SVG contains redundant path points or excessive precision; deduct 5 points if the code lacks organization or comments. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual output meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the design follows principles of professional photography: 1) Balanced composition with proper focal point 2) Appropriate contrast and tonal range in the grayscale 3) Deliberate use of negative space. Deduct 3 points for poor composition, 5 points for flat or uniform contrast lacking photographic depth, and 5 points for awkward proportions or spacing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the rendering efficient and optimized?
checklist.description: Judge the technical efficiency of the SVG: 1) File size is appropriate for the complexity (under 10KB for simple infinity symbol) 2) Paths are optimized with minimal control points 3) Filters and effects use efficient techniques. Deduct 5 points for unnecessarily complex paths, 3 points for computationally expensive filters that could be simplified, and 5 points for render-blocking effects that slow down initial display. The full score is 10 points.
